bill_title: provide for certain penalties for leaving a gasoline station before making payment on motor fuel.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for certain penalties for leaving a gasoline station before making payment on motor fuel. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person who has dispensed motor fuel into a motor vehicle may leave the premise of an establishment which offers motor fuel for retail sale before making payment for such motor fuel. A violation of this section is theft pursuant to § 22-30A-17. Upon a person's second conviction of such theft, the court shall suspend the person's driver license or driving privilege for six months. Upon a third or subsequent conviction of such theft, the court shall suspend the person's driver license or driving privilege for one year. For any offense under this section, the court may issue an order permitting the person to operate a motor vehicle for purposes of the person's employment, attendance at school, or attendance at any court ordered counseling program. In determining whether a driver license or driving privilege should be suspended under this section, the court may not consider any offense under this section which is more than five years old. 450 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
